heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 21 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (192°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 5.7°C) and feels like temperature (down 4.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 951 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 54.6°C), dew point temperature (up 50.6°C), outside temperature (up 54.0°C), and cloud levels (up 607 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 951.3m lower than yesterday, 606.9m lower than the past week, 187.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1078m minimum and 4940m maximum, with an average of 1538.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 2150m and 1726.1m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dim outside. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (2.2°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
